page.title: 01PUTTENHAM AND WANBOROUGH
page.content: The narrow chalk ridge known as the {Hog's Back}runs east to west between Guildford and Farnham and the lovely villages of Puttenham and Compton are sheltered on the southern slopes. Wanborough lies on the northern side. {The North Downs Way}runs through {Puttenham}with its old cottages, farmhouses and converted barns, to pass the church amid the trees. Although still a farming village it is the home of artists and sculptors. There are large areas of common and woodland to the south.{Wanborough}is a hamlet with a tiny old church, a manor house with an interesting history, and a magnificent tythe barn built by the monks of Waverley Abbey. The North Downs Way crosses the Golf course on Puttenham Heath and passes the Watts Gallery as it reaches{Compton}with its ancient church.
